Reviews.Title: “Check in at the Bar”
Reviews.Author: MBM212
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel since the early 1990s. I love the fact that you check in at the bar! It is a charming place in the 5th on a quiet square and a stone's throw from Notre Dame. In the summertime, the restaurant has tables outside and it can be a nice spot for an aperitif or dinner though the cuisine - simple plats - are underwhelming. There are probably less than 10 rooms (6?) and each is decorated uniquely - some more elaborate than others. My favorite has been the large room on the 2nd floor. My least favorite has been on the top floor. The rooms could use a makeover as they are looking a bit worn. With no elevator, the staircase is steep and winding but the hotel staff will assist you with your luggage. We always love the breakfast which consists of croissants, pain, beurre, confiture, yaort and fresh squeezed jus d'orange. You can enjoy it in the restaurant until 10 am or have it delivered to your room. For many years when making reservations we went through Nicole who we got to know over time though she was not there the last time we went. It's a good spot that has provided hospitality to me and my family for 2 decades.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sparkely
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located less than 5 mins walk from Notre Dame and is a perfect base to explore Paris, booking the room was simple and the directions from the metro to hotel flawless, we stayed in room 36 which has three windows overlooking the little square and a good sized bathroom, the hotel was spotless, breakfast just gorgeous and such a romantic quiet area, minutes walk from the hussle and bustle of the latin quarter yet when in the room it was silent except for the bells of Notre Dame chiming in the distance. Staff were very friendly and helpful, if travelling to Paris again I would defnitely stay here, there is no lift so if one has mobility issues maybe it is not the place, but for location, romance, great food, and an original french experience it is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “For a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: BeyondBlame
Reviews.Content: Close to the Notre Dame, this is a small hotel with character. It is a bit worn in places and given the location prices are not low, but with its small winding staircase and secluded feel, it is perfect for a romantic weekend. There's a cafe with a cat downstairs where a simple French breakfast is served. No elevator. Several good small restaurants are nearby, as is the station Saint-Michel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: LANYC1110
Reviews.Content: The service may not be the best, but the location is ideal, the rooms are so charming, the breakfast is delicious, and it's a throw-back to a bygone era. I loved this place. Be forewarned, the stairs are steep and tough to navigate, so this may not be the best option if you have a lot of luggage or if you have physcial issues with stairs. Otherwise, this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Old Paris”
Reviews.Author: ManUtdfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter, across the river from Notre Dame. If you like this area (I always stay in this area), you can't do better. The hotel has all the ambience of an older Parisian hotel. I stayed there twice this trip, and both rooms were pretty small (the second was extremely small), but the prices were most reasonable. The bathrooms are modern, though small. I was content to be in basic accommodations such as these in Paris since it seemed quite old school, and I was rarely in the room. I would not want to get sick and spend a full day in the room, however. For short stays, I would happily stay here again. The hotel runs an excellent restaurant. The breakfasts are good and include fresh-squeezed OJ.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bartholdi7
Reviews.Content: Most of our European hotel recommendations come from 'Trip Advisor' and 'Charming Small Hotels' and Les Degres Hotel du Notre Dame came from both sites. This quaint establishment offers comfortable and generally small rooms except for room 501 which is huge. If you choose 501 please make sure your legs are sturdy as the narrow stairs to the 5th floor can be a fete. If you have baggage a staff member is eager to assist. All staff members are very friendly and most helpful. A very good continental breakfast awaits you each morning to begin your walks around Paris. The hotel also provides a reasonble delicious dinner menu. Notre Dame, the Marais, and St. Germain des Pres are but a stones throw from the hotel. We've already booked our room for our next visit in Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: summerholiday2008
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a three night stay at the hotel and I agree entirely with the comments about the perfect location and the very friendly staff. My husband and I were staying in room 24 which was full of character, clean and comfortable although my only criticism was the bathroom was in need of redecoration and the wifi didn't work unless you sat downstairs in the restaurant area. We had dinner in the restaurant on our first night and the food was delicious, they also do a very reasonable lunch menu and judging by the crowds on Friday it's a very popular location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great value, Great Hostesses!”
Reviews.Author: huskies828
Reviews.Content: We spent out 10yr anniversary in Paris and stayed here for several nights. The hotel itself is, as many others have noted, very charming. The rooms were clean, large enough and very comfortable. We stayed in Rm 41, with views of Notre Dame. We took the RER from CDG and after a 40min ride, got off the train, walked 2 blocks and were there. So convenient. Every morning we started with the hotel breakfast, which was included...fresh OJ and baked bread were incredible. From there it was walk across the street to the batobus and you were off. I would stay here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, but the hotel was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: spankeeham
Reviews.Content: If I could rate this place solely based on location, I would give it 6 stars. All other aspects of this hotel are average to poor. The room that we stayed in (#5) was in an apartment building opposite of the main hotel. There was a machine shop located right below our room. Therefore, on Monday and Tuesday, it was impossible to sleep in past 8am. I think that's unacceptable. There was no internet in that building, and the only place where the WiFi signal was decent was the restaurant. I really got an impression that the owners were more interested in running their Moroccan restaurant than servicing the hotel residents (but I won't say that they were unfriendly). My biggest complaint is that the guest CANNON have food in their rooms. What kind of bull s%*t is that? And whoever said that the hotel is "very French" in the way the rooms were decorated is delirious. There were just a bunch of cheap pictures all over the wall in no particular order.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: caridel
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located in the heart of Paris, walking distance to everything. The personal service is exceptional. The room very spacious and clean with a nice rustic charm. Even when it is very close to the most lively area in Paris it is very quiet at night. The restaurant, excellent food at very good prices. But what we really liked was the staff, really nice and helpful with that special touch of family business. We will definitely be back next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok but some drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: ac1510
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quaint and no frills in a great location. I thought the staff was great and addressed any issues in a friendly and professional manner. That being said, there are a few drawbacks that would probably make me choose another hotel next time. Room- the room you get really makes a difference to the quality of your stay. I stayed in three different rooms during my stay and can tell you there is a world of difference. Rm 501 is fantastic and should be the first pick for any couples. I would avoid Rm 10 at all costs. This room is very tiny and noisy in the evening and early from kitchen noise. There were also ants in the bathroom. I didn't see them in any other rooms though. Noise- it's a bit noisy at night from traffic along the Seine. This seems to be more prevalent on the upper floors. Pillows- this may be minor to some but the pillows are terrible. Again, this varies by room. Stairs- not an issue for me but anyone who has trouble climbing stairs will not be able to stay here. There are a lot of stairs! Over all the stay was good but not great. For the location, it was worth putting up with the minor annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place to stay! Will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: robandshelley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights over Easter. On previous trips we stayed in the 7th so this was a new area for us. The hotel is great. We loved the age of the building, the winding stairway with its worn timbers, and decorations. We had the recommended room 24 which we really enjoyed. The only thing I wish it had was more lights. It was dim and romantic, but not very good for reading or trying to get organized for the next day at the really cool old table. The hotel has that worn but not run down feel that we really like. The bathroom was up to date, spotless, with plenty of water pressure. The staff was excellent. Our french is very basic, so we relied on a lovely young woman, Maria (?), quite a bit. Her english was much better than she thought it was and she was very helpful. One evening we were wanting to go to a play and did not know how to reserve the tickets. She took our information and made the reservations, paid for the tickets and everything. All of the staff was helpful, and patient with our french. The nice lady who serves breakfast was very efficient, and I got to practice my french since she spoke no english. The breakfast was good and it was included in the room. I especially enjoyed the fresh orange juice and breads. Being right in the middle of things was a new experience for us. It was a little noisier and crowded of course, but was a fair tradeoff for being steps away from the river and all the action. You can have an "Anne Hathaway moment" across from the hotel as a scene from The Devil Wears Prada was filmed there. It is on a short little street that dispite being maybe 50 steps from the main street along the Seine, seemed like you were out of the bustle of tourists and traffic. We would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a friendly, cozy hotel in a building with real history.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Family Run Business”
Reviews.Author: BernieCastle
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Les Degres (sourced via Tripadvisor) Stayed here for four nights over Christmas.The cold and snow did not affect our stay as the Hotel is in such a good location. Our room on the first floor was small but not uncomfortable for a four night stay (excellent value) we were informed of this prior to our arrival. Whilst there, the staff were kind enough to show us other rooms in the Hotel which are more spacious - all the rooms are uniquely decorated and furnished. If you are looking for a hotel in Paris that has all of the 'usual facilities' and you are used to the 'Chain Hotels' I suggest that Les Degres may not be for you. Personally after several vists to Paris in the past. I would not stay anywhere else. Freshly squeezed orange juice for breakfast...such a rare treat! We also dined here and the quality of food that comes out of it's tiny kitchen is quite amazing. ALL of the staff were friendly, helpful and we were made to feel very welcome Paris can be very expensive, the Beer/Wine/ Food prices at Les Degres are VERY reasonable. If you are visiting the Latin Quarter, take the time to visit Les Degres. Sample the food and ask to see the accommodation. You may be very pleasantly suprised

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonamom
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful anniversary week. The location of the hotel is great. You are two blocks from a metro station, right by the Notre Dame. Area where hotel is located is very quiet and safe, even though area surrounding it is bustling with activity. We were in room 24 which is very charming. My only suggestion for this room would be a set of drawers to store your clothes. There is a closet and big table. Bathroom is roomy with double sinks. The charm of this hotel is the people and breakfast. I loved going downstairs for the complementary breakfast. You can go anytime from 7:00 am to 10:00 am. And everyone is so friendly. The staff is very helpful, helping you plan your day or giving directions. Hotel was completely booked by people who were all well traveled. I felt like I was somehow in the know, booking this hotel. Will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “All the character expected with efficient booking and good welcome”
Reviews.Author: Scanners22
Reviews.Content: I researched for many a long hour a Paris hotel to celebrate my wife's big birthday - it had to come with character, great location and quirkiness and Les Degres de Notre Dame did not disappoint at all. Although we did not get one of the advertised (and commented on) rooms, ours was more than acceptable and roomy, with an artist's bohemian, but never shabby, touch. Breakfast was good too and the position...just leaving a hotel and walking is a great experience. No need for metro or cab. Charming and recommended, at at 120 euros for a night not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and cute”
Reviews.Author: LeilaA
Reviews.Content: I loved this beautiful little hotel-- the location is great, it's adorable (with lots of old-world charm), the breakfasts were great, and the reception was friendly (overall). I would definitely recommend this place. My one hesitancy involves the stairs. The rooms are accessed via a very narrow and uneven wooden staircase. This could be very problematic if you are located on a high floor and if you are carrying big luggage.

Reviews.Title: “very French little hotel with great location near Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: simmo888
Reviews.Content: This hotel was half the price of the hotel we stayed in during our first visit to Paris. It is literally less than a miniute walk to the Sienne and maybe an extra minute walk to the Notre Dame!!! It is location, location!! The breakfasts are incredible and very french.. good coffee, fresh OJ and loads of croissants and butter.. they will even ask if you want brie/cheeses.. this good brekky is also all included in the price.. we almost couldnt believe it when we were charged only 115 euros per night. The staff are extremely patient and put up with our broken French.. althought we smiled a lot and made a point of letting them know how grateful we were for all their help. The hotel is clean, quaint and full of character. It is close to the major train station ie. Gare de Nord and Gare de Lyon. This will be our hotel of choice next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a soul...never stay anywhere else in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: peterkirchem
Reviews.Content: Been staying here for 25 years or so but haven't been for a while. Nothing has changed..still as beautiful as ever. Each room has different decor, original paintings, antique furniture of good quality. The restaurant is brilliant...we had Tagines the like of which is even hard to find in Morocco...and the location, in a quiet square within walking distance of Notre Dame is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Jenway
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay in the hotel, but tried the restaurant after reading the reviews on here about its quality. A group of 6 of us had the set menu (around 27 euros for 3 courses) and I must say it was fantastic. I had great contact with Nicole via email before we went, and then our waiter on the evening was brilliant, and very attentive. Will definitely return, and maybe even try staying there rather than the hideously overpriced Holiday Inn as well!

Reviews.Title: “Delicieux - and good value”
Reviews.Author: Oasisgirl80
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in the hotel, but came here to eat at the restaurant, which an ex-Parisian friend had recommended to me. The meal was fantastic so I wanted to write about it on here. Appearances can be deceptive, it looks very simple and not "posh". If the place had not been specifically recommended, I might have made the mistake of walking on by. However the food is excellent - the menu is a mixture of traditional French dishes (I had a delicious lamb) but also does North African cuisine (the people at the table opposite seemed to be very much enjoying their couscous). For pudding, I had one of the best creme brulees I can remember. I had a fixed price menu of 3 courses for about 26 euro, excl. drinks, which is not bad for Paris. Especially considering I paid the same price the previous evening for a sandwich, salad and pudding, with soft drink in a cafe near the Louvre! The atmosphere here is really relaxed, I was travelling alone on a business trip but felt really comfortable eating here. The waiter, who I believe was the son of the owners was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Paris (with excellent service)”
Reviews.Author: yodafish
Reviews.Content: Les Degres de Notre Dame is great place to stay in Paris. It is well located, near Notre Dame, the B RER line to airport, and restuarants in the Latin Quarter. The hotel is well-run and is in a cool old building. And the restaurant downstairs is really good and very well priced. Save yourself the time and headache of poring over all the different hotels in Paris, and just stay here if you are looking for a good value on your trip. We just stayed here for one night. And we had to leave early in the morning, so we missed out on the breakfast. But from arrival to exit, the hotel was exactly what we were looking for and helped us feel immersed in Pairs (if only for 1 day). When we overslept our alarm clocks, the friendly hotel manager bailed out us and helped us make our early flight that morning. We only have good things to say about this hotel. We hope that we can make it back here someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss eating at Les Degres!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Reporter
Reviews.Content: What we liked most about this place was the restaurant. The breakfast was great with fresh squeezed orange juice. We visited for lunch on two occasions while we were staying at a different hotel because we liked the food so much. We were never disappointed. It is the BEST food for the money. The service is excellent. The décor is charming and quaint. There are fresh paintings mixed among the collections. We stayed in room 11. We wanted to stay there for two more days but it was booked. If we stayed here again we would opt for one of the rooms at a higher rate on a higher level. It was nice to be able to open the window; however, there is a bit of street noise. The location is awesome – easy access to all forms of public transportation. One quick train ride to CDG using RER B was economical and convenient. We did miss having a lobby. This was more than made up for by the friendly and thoughtful owners.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and huge room”
Reviews.Author: historyteacher_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Les Degres in June, 2008 and are looking forward to our return visit in early July this year. We had the room on the top floor which was very large, had a great view of one of the towers of Notre Dame, and even had a huge bathroom filled with houseplants and an amusing mural. The location is only a few minutes walk from Notre Dame, so you can easily walk over and enjoy the late evening street performers. The hotel is in an old building with no lift, so it's not the right choice if you aren't fit enough to climb stairs.

Reviews.Title: “UNDERWEAR STOLEN FROM SUITCASE!!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbuchan
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a charming location and close to all the attractions. The beds and lumpy, the floors crooked and you can hear through the walls: all of this is very normal for Paris. What wasn't normal was that the cleaning staff ransacked my luggage and stole all of my underwear! I also had been shopping at Muji the previous day, and had left a bag of stationery items in the room. That too had been ransacked: one of everything was stolen (I had the receipt in my wallet to check against it). The manager was apologetic, but I felt really upset and didn't trust leaving anything (even a toothbrush!) out for the next two days. We had already pre-paid for the accommodation - otherwise I would have left. I am a well -travelled, non precious person: I've stayed in Paris four or five times and travelled extensively in Africa, Asia and Europe. If you stay in this hotel, please just be extra careful of your belongings, and watch out for your underwear! I had to waste a whole morning trying to find replacements...

Reviews.Title: “Charming and wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AmyJ888
Reviews.Content: My college-aged son and I stayed at Les Degres for 4 nights in early August. Upon arriving there it was even better than I was expecting! It was set in such a beautiful area, with lovely narrow sidestreets and shops and restaurants close by. We each had 2 pieces of luggage and once we saw the logistics of getting that luggage up to our room...we were a bit worried. But, not to worry! Nicole, the kind woman who runs the hotel quickly offered that we could leave our bags with her in the restaurant/bar area. When one of her workers came back in a bit she gladly had him deliver the bags to our room. We were thrilled! At the end of our trip he brought them down for us as well. Now, you may be wondering why so difficult to get the bags to our room? Well...this place has no elevator and our room was on the top floor. The way to get there is to walk up 5 flights of narrow, winding wooden stairs. Just walking up there with our smaller bags gave us a good workout. Which was just perfect for us! At the end of every day, even though were exhausted from walking all over Paris we were glad for that extra climb because then we didn't feel so bad about eating all the food that we love! :) The room we stayed in was #47 and is up on the 5th floor (?) The room felt very comfortable and charming and I loved the fact that I didn't feel like I was in some hotel chain room. When I came "home" to Les Degres every day I knew where I was. I was in Paris. I was in a unique 10 room hotel. It just was great to stay in such an authentic Parisian-feeling place! Our room had 2 twin beds which were comfy. A TV set which we never turned on. A fan, which we did use because the warm August nights warranted it. A nice desk. The bathroom had a twin sink which was nice, but the one less-than-ideal thing about the bathroom was the shower that was entirely enclosed in glass. We each kind of value our privacy...so when someone was in the shower, that was it. The bathroom was then taken! We worked around it, but that little detail definitely caused us to have to work out our morning showering routine. The bathroom did have a hair-dryer which was wonderful. Overall, the room was very clean and an inviting place to be. One of the highlights of staying in this room was the incredible view! Oh. My. Word. So, every night I went to bed with one of the towers of Notre Dame as my nightlight! Incredible...I could see the tower from my bed. What a lovely memory to have, falling asleep looking at that! It made me smile every single night. And a really funny aside is that the towers do not stay lit all night. At 1:00 am every night the lights go out. And they don't go out all at once. They go out switch by switch by switch. This was fun to watch and just picture someone inside doing this every night. We slept every night with the windows wide open and didn't find noise to be a problem at all. In the morning at Les Degres there was a fabulous breakfast (included in the price of the room) that was ready the minute we sat down. Just perfect to start the day. A plate of baguette pieces, croissants, jam & butter, 2 kinds of cheeses, tea, coffee & freshly squeezed orange juice. And I do mean fresh...they run the oranges through the machine right there in front of you and then serve it up. Heaven!! And the coffee is absolutely wonderful. Nicole makes a nice pitcher of strong, delicious coffee and then serves it with a smaller pitcher of steamed, lightly frothed milk. I really really miss starting my days with her fabulous coffee. And I am a very picky person when it comes to coffee. My son had his own small pot of tea every morning. The location of Les Degres is great. Right next to the Seine...wonderful for strolling. It's so close to the St Michel Metro stop and is an easy walk to the Louvre, Musee d' Orsay, Sainte Chapelle and of course Notre Dame. And the Latin Quarter is just a great, great, great location. I cannot say enough about it. There were many times that my son & I commented to each other how grateful we were to be staying in that area. So charming, interesting, busy, fun and close by to lots of things. When we needed any advice Nicole was so helpful and she spoke impeccable English, which was so kind. I do not know much French and it was nice to be able to communicate. She was very nice and even booked a cab for us on our return back to the airport. The cab driver she uses is great too. I don't know his name, but he was very attentive & prompt. He loved telling us everything he knew about Paris on our drive back to the airport! If I ever get to visit Paris again I will most definitely stay at Les Degres de Notre Dame. It was a delight!

Reviews.Title: “great location for Paris sights”
Reviews.Author: gibraltarr
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her 2 teenage friends stayed here. I saw the hotel on arrival. The location was brilliant for Notre Dame, Louvre and the river. It is near metro stops too. It was easy to get to from CDG as it is a short walk from the B RER line, however you do need to have wheels on your suitcase to make it a comfortable walk! The girls stayed in the annexe of the hotel, a large room across the road from the hotel. They loved it and called it their little home in Paris. They said that there was night life around, and really filled up their 5 nights. It was clearly just a 3 star hotel, but a fair price for Paris and it included breakfast. They are longing to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WoodyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights last August after recommendations from friends. It is a quaint little boutique hotel just across the Seine from the Notre Dame and we found the location superb. We had one of the smaller rooms on the first floor which was quite adequate and at 140 euros per night with breakfast was reasonably expensive (2 NZ$ to the euro) but the service from friendly Nicole and the delicious croissants every morning and the location more than made up. Larger rooms with a view are also available at a dearer price. Nearby there are plentiful cheap and cheerful restaurants. We prebooked with Nicole over the net without any difficulties at all. Being first time visitors with only 3 days to explore the main parts of the city we got a 2 day pass on the 'hop-on-hop-off" red bus from the square in front of the Notre Dame, and having done a complete circuit of around 1 1/2 hours on the first day to get our bearings, we then had the confidence to hop off at various stops, explore and maybe walk to the next leg. We felt this service was excellent value and a must for first time visitors. We hope to visit Paris again in the future and would defintely stay in Les Degres de Notre Dame Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate room, but unpleasant odor”
Reviews.Author: Pirate_Bill
Reviews.Content: The location of Les Degres de Notre Dame is unbeatable. Room was small but adequate. Breakfast, which was included in the price, was a very nice plus, and the orange juice was wonderful. Price was very good for the location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Not air conditioned, and sleeping with the windows open in July was a little noisy, even though it is on a relatively quiet street. But, my only real complaint was that the hall and our room smelled distinctly of urine.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: nolesrule
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at Les Degres de Notre Dame for our 10th anniversary last July. We stayed in Room 501, the attic suite that has a view of the cathedral. Such a beautiful room, in a great hotel in a wonderful location. The proprietors were friendly and took care of all our needs. Our room was ready when we arrived before 9am. A short walk from many of the must-see locations in Paris, and a metro station even closer to get to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe and Montmartre. As a native Floridian, the fresh squeezed orange juice with breakfast was a wonderful touch. Considering the location, the price for the room was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Full of charm”
Reviews.Author: swg
Reviews.Content: Great little B&B 2 minutes walk from the Notre Dame (you could see the towers from our room - Room 501). It was a little pricey but so is everything in Paris I suppose! It's very central to a lot of sights, although the Eiffel Tower and Arc De Triomphe are a good hour's walk away. The hotel is above a restaurant (where breakfast is also served). It has no lift and a very narrow wooden staircase so I wouldn't recommend it to the 'unfit' but overall it's a great place to stay in the heart of the Latin Quarter. We saw the main sights during our 2 day stay but the highlight was definitely the Notre Dame (we visited on Sunday morning during a service and it was very emotional - and I am not religious in any way). The hotel is 15 minutes walk across the river to the Louvre. The breakfast at the hotel is great - freshly squeezed orange juice, yoghurt, croissant, bread, cheese, jam, tea, coffee, hot chocolate and served by a very pleasant young man. You can also have your evening meal at the Hotel's restaurant although we didn't do this but probably would have done if we had been staying longer. All in all, a great trip (even though it did rain nearly all the time) and would definitely recommend Les Degres de Notre Dame. Easy to find. From Gare du Nord train station, get the RER B line and get off at St Michel (Notre Dame) or get the metro to the same stop. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from St Michel (Notre Dame) stop (on the same side of the river). Thanks Nicole for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Luckyscout
Reviews.Content: I have read many reviews about this hotel. Most are raving about it, some did not like it at all. I took a chance and booked it last summer. I loved every thing about it! Nicole was very nice, she does have an interesting, sort of dry sense of humor and I really liked her. My room on the first floor, it is up the stairs as the resturaunt is on the bottom floor, was great. I had a view of a little intersection, very, very small side street with trees and views of shops and resturaunts. I ate one dinner at the hotel resturaunt, it was the best roasted chicken with vegis I have had! I was on a budget so it was a bit more expensive than I could pay, or I would have eaten there every night. Breakfast everymorning was great, greeted and served yogurt or bread, coffee, etc. Nice location, just walk about 5 min and you cross the Saine and are at Notre Dame. I would like to stay here again, and someday I will return! Nice and quiet area, weekend market in the opposite direction of Notre Dame away from the Saine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely-Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: spartans300
Reviews.Content: We loved our time here. Fantastic free breakfast, don't miss the fresh squeezed orange juice. Very helpful owner. Rooms are very clean, but small. Shower is refreshingly hot. Walk out the front and you see Notre Dame. 2 blocks down is an outdoor market, where you can stock up on baguette, cheese, sausage and wine for the day of exploring. The underground subway is right next to the market. Would stay again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ACW_Oslo
Reviews.Content: This is just a very charming hotel. It has a really authentic parisien feel to it - it really has personality. The staff are very friendly. Our room was lovely and spacious. Both breakfast and lunch are great at the hotel. The location is also wonderful, very close to Notre Dame and the latin quarter. A lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: Miriam021
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for four nights at the Hotel des Grands Degres last May. Since a single room wasn't available for all four night, they kindly offered me a big one for the last two nights (photos are from that one.) The single room (in the first floor, room # 10, 95 euros per night) was really small but adequate: I didn't intend to stay in there too long, after all! It was clean and tidy, so no complaints. The big one (in the second floor, room # 24) was really nice, with a view of the street and a huge dining space! At a rate of 165 euros, it wasn't cheap for one person, but I would certainly recommend it for a couple looking for a romantic experience! But the main attraction of this cozy hotel is in my opinion, the location. Everything is close! And there are many subway stations and taxi stops a couple of blocks from the hotel. Staff was nice and helpful, and the French complimentary breakfast is OK. I didn't eat at the small restaurant because there are so many different choices around, but it looked cute. The lack of elevator may be quite a problem for older or disabled travellers, but if you can walk up the stairs, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanj1310
Reviews.Content: The room was good size, clean and comfortable. The location is excellant, there are loads of great places to eat around the neighborhood. The subway, bus stops and taxi ranks are all within a few minutes walk. Definitely would recommend this hotel for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, I am sorry to say.”
Reviews.Author: Serendipity3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times, both when on business and for pleasure, both with friends and alone. It has a great location and although it has been raising its prices rather steeply in recent years for the Veme it's not really that expensive, although I do think one pays a premium for the proximity to Notre Dame (even without the view). The rooms are shabby, but quite clean (the maid washes the parquet floors!) and even if some bathrooms are cramped it is true that the water pressure is great. However, reading through the reviews I have to agree with Mikey in Paris - I think some guests have seen this hotel through rose-coloured spectacles. Anyone who finds the food the best they ate in Paris really needs to get out more, and sometimes the management can be very unhelpful (like refusing to call for a taxi when it is pouring with rain and one has luggage). However the majority of the staff are in fact quite polite and helpful, (it helps to speak really fluent French) which is why it grieves me to say that I have decided never to go back. On my last visit I overheard the owner's son abuse a lone and unassuming foreign woman (in French) becasue she had failed to finish her main course, but had then politely asked for the dessert included in her prix fixe meal. Clearly he thought she couldn't understand, but of couse, I did, and I consider such behaviour inexcusable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice for our days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarolineLouisiana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here several nights in late December, 2007. We were very pleased to find the hotel located in a relatively quiet area, even though quite near the Seine and just minutes from Notre Dame and the Ile de la Cite and Ile de St. Louis. This was very central for our interest in exploring on foot in the Marais (just on the other side of the Ile de St. Louis) and in the Latin Quarter and 6th arrondisement. There were plenty of good restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel itself is a small one with about 10 rooms and it has great old character, including attractive art. The tiny little restaurant on the first floor where the breakfast is served is also open throughout the day and into the night for drinks, or meals. Though there are no elevators and the rooms are located up a small, wooden stairwell - there is assistance in bringing baggage up and down. The hotel manager was extremely efficient and helped us in many ways. Our room was large, though there was the occasional low beam to remember to duck. The bathroom was wonderfully large and fairly recently renovated with plumbing fixtures. Really good for us. Would not be good for folks not able to climb stairs or for those looking for a high degree of luxury. We would not stay here in summer as there is no air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tourer_Dave
Reviews.Content: This small 10-room hotel was perfect for seeing the sights and walking the Latin Quarter and St Germain de Pres. Very convenient (3 blocks) to Ille St. Louis, with it's unique shops, bakeries, restaurants, and fabulous ice cream parlors. Use the Bateaubus (boat bus) to see the sights along the Seine (on and off all day for 11Euros. Nicole, the Manager was there all day to provide any needed assistance in English, as was the owner's son in the evening. The restaurant was very good. Half of the evenings we had dinner in the hotel restaurant, because the food was delicious and there is a surprisingly varied menu. Very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Anglaise7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus our 20 year old stayed in the apartment across the road from the hotel (Room 5) for 6 nights, and it was perfect. We did not feel cramped even with 3 big suitcases in the room. You enter into an apartment building and go down a hallway, through a small courtyard (which was under construction while we were there, but not noisy) to reach the apartment door. Enter through a tiny hall and up one narrow, short flight of stairs to the apartment which is very bright and roomy. There is one double bed and one single bed in a large room along with a chaise longue, a small wardrobe, a desk and several chairs. The bathroom (new) was great - 2 sinks and a bath and shower (very good) under a big opening skylight. There was a small refrigerator in the bathroom (useful for drinks and snacks,) but there are no cooking facilities, not that you'll need them with all the great cafes and restaurants in the neighborhood. The room was very quiet and clean, and the beds very comfortable. The staff were very professional and helpful, and the dinner we had at the restaurant was the best meal we had in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonably priced............”
Reviews.Author: Sproutandabout
Reviews.Content: Tucked nicely away on the eastern edge of the Latin Quarter in Paris' 6th Arrondisement this small, efficiently run 10 roomed hotel proved an ideal base from which to explore the left bank and beyond. A safe distance from the throbbing mass of dreadul eateries and nightspots that prosititue themselves round the back of the Cluny Museum and the side streets that flank it ( Rue de la Huchette is, indeed, an experience), the hotel offers great access to the district’s many attractions, vibrant café culture and general pervading air of intellectual and artistic form that shapes it. The imposing figure of Notre Dame’s Cathedral looms large across the seine, Boulevard St Germain bustles to the south and weaving between are numerous sidestreets with many hidden delights. Many of the City’s famed eateries are nestled closeby. Iconic local institutions, young pretenders and many somewhere in between all work the culinary magic that has injected life into the area for decades. A strong concentration of Bistros, Brasseries, cafes and regional French restaurants dominate with contemporary and international variations supporting them admirably. All budgets and belt sizes catered for. The hotel itself is clean, functional and comfortable. We booked at very short notice for three nights, having to take a different room each night; an excellent way to get a feel for the whole place! Visitors to the City will be all too aware of what you can expect to pay to rest your head in Central Paris. It provided genuinely affordable comfort that won’t appeal to the chic, boutique crowd (another distinct advantage). Quirky and interesting décor with good essentials ( great showers, relatively quiet for its location, ample breakfast remembering this is Europe, clean etc, helpful staff). The friendly owners cover up the obligatory inadequacies of the English speaking majority operating overseas with a near non-existent command of another language with good grace and plenty of smiles. Astonishing how people still fail to learn please and thank you! In summary, if you book and arrive with realistic expectations they will be exceeded. Chose even numbered rooms if available (slightly bigger) and the advertised ‘views over Notre Dame’ require some imagination and gymnastic qualities to be truly realised. You can catch a glimpse of the turret on the west Knave if you lean far enough out of the window! Poetic licence is a wonderful thing;as was our weekend in Paris. N.b. No lift to the four floors but no excuses either for the fully mobile. In a City offering so many calorific treats the exercise is very necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgerstenberger
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel and found it to be a reasonable place to stay. Pros: clean, good breakfast, nice location. Cons: some people might be put off by the small spiral staircase that goes up to the rooms, the Latin Quarter isn't what it used to be in terms of atmosphere and restaurant selection (but there remain plenty of good dining choices within easy walking distance - head over to Ile St. Louis, for example).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kaahele_wannabe
Reviews.Content: Since I love Paris so much, I feel like I could stay in the sewers and still enjoy the city. But luckily, we had reservations at Les Degres and could not have been more satisfied. It was not the nicest hotel we've stayed at in Europe, but it had several things going for it: Location, Location, Location. Right across the street from Notre Dame, walking distance from many of the sights, great restaurants, fun neighborhood, internet cafe around the corner, close to Metro, etc, etc... Cost. The hotel cost was cheap, so the room was small, the bathroom nondescript, no closet, etc...We didn't care. Again, can't beat the location at that price and we were hardly in our room. Except at night, and the bed was actually quite comfy for two singles pushed together. Bring earplugs though for the noise. Breakfast. The breakfast each morning was your basic cafe au lait, croissant, butter, jam, french bread; a-ok by me. Guide books. There is a room off to the side of the restaurant that is sort of a mini-library, filled with guidebooks on Paris and other cities that you are welcome to check out. Staff. Nicole was pleasant to work with via e-mail and very nice in-person, as well. Be aware that there are only 1-2 English speaking staff members and they are usually only there until 5 p.m. Brush up on your French. Even if you botch words up, they appreciate the effort you make in trying to speak their language. I recommend some of the downloadable Learn French iBooks you can load onto your iPod. Disappointments - none, really. If you know what to expect before you book (and aren't looking for Ritz quality at 110e per night price), you'll enjoy Les Degres. p.s...sorry for only the 1 pic, forgot to take pics of the room. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Veruka
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Les Degres during the first week of May and had a very lovely experience. I booked it after reading all of the more recent reviews (I booked in January or February of this year) and felt there were most positive than negative ones. What I wanted was a small hotel in a typical Parisien area, so we decided to concentrate on the 5th. My boyfriend was also hoping for a place with decent-sized rooms because we knew hotel rooms in Paris would be smaller than American standards. The one thing that no one can dispute is the amazing location of this hotel! It's literally about a block and a half south of Notre-Dame Cathedral. We would use the Cathedral as a signpost to know how to get back to the hotel. The street itself was quiet though there's a very busy area of bars and restaurants only a few blocks away and occasionally people would walk through that street after leaving the bars and would be talking loudly. We booked room 36, so not the biggest room (I believe that would be the one on the 5th floor) but it was definitely large enough for our needs. We were staying 6 nights and brought enough clothes for the changable weather, but I must be used to living out of a suitcase because the lack of dressers didn't phase me. I used the closet to hang a few things but the rest stayed in the luggage, or on the floor, to be honest. The bathroom was a bit oddly laid out but spacious. It had a large bathtub and shower (great water pressure, too!) with sliding glass doors. There were two sinks and ample counter room for our toiletries. The bathroom had its own windows so you could get rid of the steam easily. We had asked for a queen/king bed and did discover that it was two twin beds put together, but I actually didn't notice this for a number of nights! The bed seemed fine to me and I slept very well. I did realize that there was no clock in the room, which is rather strange, but I had my cell phone set to local time and we used the alarm function on that to wake up in time for breakfast. I don't know if the room next to ours (there were only two rooms on that floor) was empty during the first few days of our stay, but even after we were sure that some people were staying there, we didn't hear a peep out of them. My boyfriend had asked that I find a place that had breakfast included, which was another reason we went with Les Degres, and we weren't disappointed. True, it's not the biggest breakfast, but it was fine for both of us. It included fresh-squeezed OJ, coffee or tea, one croissant per person, jam, butter, and a whole (medium-sized) baguette. I stuck with the croissant which left all the bread for my boyfriend, but we were satisfied with the meal. I was surprised to find there there isn't any lobby to speak of, and that if you needed to talk to someone you had to go into the dining area or kitchen. I found the staff to be helpful and nice, especially Nicole and Cecile when I was emailing to make the arrangements. I speak French so that's how I interacted with the staff. Twice I needed to ask for something (forgotten bathroom cups and the iron) and they were able to take care of it quickly. We were on the third floor and there is no elevator, so my boyfriend was grumbling a bit each time we went up to the room, but we're both healthy enough not to have a serious problem with it. If my parents had been staying there, however, I think they would have been unhappy. All in all, we were happy with our experience there. It was a good-sized room in a perfect location that served breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Honest Review You'll Read”
Reviews.Author: MissP76
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for the first time with a friend this week and had an absolutely incredible time. Since this site was such a huge help to me, i wanted to give back with a 100% honest review of Les Degres Hotel. PROS: -LOCATION:)--After walking what seemed like every square inch of Paris, you simply can not beat this location. Situated on a quiet street in the 5th, it is right around the corner from Notre Dame, 1 block from the Seine and 3 or 4 blocks from the Metro. Perfection! It was exactly how i pictured Paris. -Breakfast was included. If you're one of those people who needs a gigantic breakfast, you may want to look elsewhere, but if you want a light fare of croissant, bread, coffee and juice, it was nice to have a free meal every morning. And the orange juice was fantastic! -Price was totally affordable. 110 Euro a night for a "double." -Room--We stayed in room 11 and it was about what I expected for Paris/European standards. Remember kids, this is NOT the 4 Seasons. It's a tiny boutique hotel. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was a decent size and had incredible water pressure. And the view was lovely. -Booking was easy. I did everything through email and the staff got back to me immediately. In English. -Nicole and Cecile, the 2 women who run the hotel were very friendly and spoke perfect English. They made us feel very welcome. Now for the Cons: -There is no lobby whatsoever in this hotel, therefore no front desk or concierge. The women who run the hotel are there til 5 pm but after that, you're on your own. Since it was our first visit to Paris we could have used a little guidance and maybe help making reservations, etc. -There is no clock in the room. You can arrange a wake up call but it's not guaranteed to come. We almost missed our car on the last day because of this. Bring a battery operated alarm clock. -There are no dressers in the room, only a teeny closet, a desk and 2 nightstands. 2 women traveling in one of the most fashionable cities in the world with no dresser? You can imagine what the room looked like. -I asked for 2 single beds when making the reservation. We walked in to find 2 single beds that were pushed together and sharing the same headboard. It's a good thing my friend and I are close:) If you're traveling with someone you don't want to share a bed with, I recommend getting separate rooms. -There is no elevator in the hotel and no ground floor. Even the first floor requires stair climbing. It was fine for us but could be problematic for some. -Only a few staff members spoke English. I speak French, my friend did not, so she struggled a bit when i wasn't there. -We only made about 5 local calls yet our phone bill was 40 Euro??? If we would have known that we would have used a calling card for everything and not just long distance. -Skip the restaurant downstairs for all meals except for breakfast. It was pricey and just ok. 4 Euro for a Coke?? Is this standard? -No internet connection so don't bring a laptop. I'd recommend using the internet cafe around the corner if you absolutely need to use a computer. All in all we had a very lovely time at the hotel and I would certainly go back, because of the location more than anything. There is a fantastic restaurant on the same street called Le Reminet as well as anything else you could possibly want. I hope this review covered all territory. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Location, View, Location”
Reviews.Author: JimandMarilyn
Reviews.Content: While we did have a little trouble communicating via the internet with the hotel it was well worth the effort! We had seen several reviews in the paper, read the ones posted here and we anxiously awaited our visit. We booked the "suite" on the top floor, a little more expensive but not overly, well worth the price! The stairs gave us the opportunity to work off a little of the extra eating, the wonderful croissants at breakfast, and the chocolates we could'nt resist. The stairs are narrow and steep, you just need to take your time. The staff are very friendly, accomodating, and speak very passable English. The location is the best! Off the busy streets but very convenient to Metro, Ave St.Germaine, and best of all the Ile Cite. We were able to walk everywhere or take the Metro. The hotel is "rustic" but very well maintained. On subsequent trips this would be our one and only choice. The other rooms we could see were very well appointed and we would certainly take one of them if the top floor room was not available. Please say hello to Nicolloe, Shannon, and Cecile - the very friendly staff - they were excellent, helpful, and there when you needed them! If you like cats they have the most friendly one I have ever seen - Tom, he rules the hotel! This hotel is everything you would expect in a true Paris boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tres magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Randy1
Reviews.Content: Although not for the George V or Ritz set, it was a wonderful way to experience Paris up close. I booked it myself on-line and we spent 10 nights (3 in the hotel and 7 in the nearby apartment). The hotel itself is situated right between (two blocks in either direction) Blvd St. Germain and the cathedral. The Pantheon, Place St. Michel, Musee Cluny and the Luxemburg Gardens are all a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. The only real surprize was the qualtiy of the restaurant which was much better than the restaurants in and around St. Severin (the closest thing to a food court you'll find in Paris), which is about 3 blocks away. Nicole, the manager, was very helpful, even arranging for our luggage to be taken up and down the stairs (twice!). My wife, who half expected to hate Paris is already talking about next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: tcombs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 48 on the TOP floor. View of Notre Dame out the bathroom window. Really not a bad place, but the stairs are daunting! steep and narrow. That being said. I think it was an average room for the price in Paris. Hotel staff very good. Accomidating and fun. It is a excellent location, nearby metro, and really very quite for Paris. I would recommend it again.

Reviews.Title: “Central to all paris”
Reviews.Author: goso
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights following a recommendation by a friend and reading the reviews on Trip advisor and others. A very comfortable hotel, eventhough the stairs would be difficult for the elderly or unfit. Stay on 1st or 2nd floor if you are in these categories. The hotel restaurant is excellent, for both lunch and dinner. I would definately stay here again, and with the river ferry [ altobus ] stop 100 metres away, a great base to see all the main attractions Paris has to offer. Nicole and her staff were always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: sfnetpro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days in May of 2006. This hotel is situated 1 block from Notre Dame on one of the most picturesque ancient streets in Paris. When the taxi pulled up in front of the hotel we thought we had died and went to heaven. The owner and the entire staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The little restaurant inside is a real find. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants an authentic Parisian experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: michaelmfl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Les Deges de Notre Dame for 5 nights. There is a spiral staircase to get to the guest rooms. The walk up to our fourth floor room was a bit tiring after a long day. Our room -36- was spacious and clean with exposed wooden beams in the ceiling. The three sets of double windows opened out to the quiet side street. There is no air conditioning, but we did not need it. If it had been hotter the three big windows would have provided a lot of ventilation. The bathroom was large and clean. It had a tub and shower with plenty of hot water. The room had a color TV. Breakfast was included with the room price, it included croissants, fresh baguette, butter and jellies, fresh squeezed orange juice, and choice of hot beverage. Located very near Notre Dame, and close to two Metro stops and the RER lines. The staff spoke English, and were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “rude response to reservation enquiry”
Reviews.Author: ludwigvon
Reviews.Content: When I emailed the hotel to ask if it is possible to take a room without breakfast (the website states it is not included, but the quote does include it) I received a terse reply. It said "we note you are not interested in our room, we never make offers". The hotel prices seem to have been raised quite a lot from last year eg. room 47 April 2005 E100: price quoted for May 2006, E140. Glad I found out that customer service NOT one of this hotel's strong points before I booked! I'll be looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Parisian Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: PhillipP
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner travelled to Paris on a very short weekend break (2 nights) in December to do some Christmas shopping. The hotel was recommended to us by friends - I did not have the time to look it up so we just booked it. I think we were quite lucky that there was an available room - booked it less than a month before we went. It is a beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. Opposite the Norte Dame, although not so obvious from the exterior, the rooms were pure luxury. Our room, to be precise, was large, with a wooden floor and ceiling. The shower-room had not long been renovated. There is no lift available, and although the long spiral stairway is a bit of a task to complete, it is well worth it. The reception staff were extremely attentive and looked after us thoughout our stay. We were late arriving and although the kitchen had closed, the welcoming reception staff arranged for us to have a meal at the hotel. Breakfast was also lovely - traditional parisian croissants with semi-freshly squeezed orange juice, hot drinks etc (but not buffet). You also get the option of breakfast being served in your room. Upon departure, they also stored our luggage until late in the afternoon when we headed off to the airport. My only complain is the price. While there, we were informed that the prices were going up for 2006 - I personally found the price we paid average. Not cheap but not extortionate. I somehow feel that the new prices may be a bit too much, but I would still try and get a room there when I am in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Same experience - can't get a booking”
Reviews.Author: tal27
Reviews.Content: I agree with the last review - I have tried to book into this hotel also based on the reviews here on this very useful website, only to be told that they only take bookings for their regular guests unless the booking is for a long stay. I was advised to contact them the week before arrival, and if they had availability they would then be able to book me in. All of which is fair enough, however does not really make the place a hotel, more of a club.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel IF you can manage to get a reservation”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: I have tried to stay at Les Degres de Notre Dame hotel for two years now especially based on the recommendations both here and from an acquaintance. This past week I thought I would ask again for a 2006 reservation. The staff said it's too early to make a reservation and not only that, the rooms are booked for 'regulars'. This did not seem right to me. I explained to the staff member that it's unfair. The following day, Nicole, emailed me a long message to say that because the hotel is so small they only reserve long stays (5-7 days) and for regular guests first. They book short stays (e.g. 2 nights) sometimes but not always on weekends. Her words are "At the moment we are taking long stays just till the end of 2005. We are taking short stays only till october if they are not for week-ends, or if the stays are after, or before another long one." So don't even bother to request a 2 night stay at this hotel unless you can rearrange your plans to suit the hotel's strict and unfair reservation policy. I've concluded that there are other hotels (small ones even) that have no problem taking a short or long stay without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and homey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor and other reviews. We were a party of 3, staying in #48 and #47. #48 cost 115€ and has a full bed and a convertible single bed. The room, with bath, has 3 windows and is airy and pretty. #47, right next door also with bath, cost 100€ and is smaller with only one window so is more cramped. But, you can see the Notre Dame from one side of the bed! The room has 2 single beds which can be pushed together. Staff is very friendly, and Nicole speaks great English if you need it. Classic, copious continental breakfast: coffee/tea/etc, all the baguette you can eat, butter/preserves, fresh-pressed OJ. The rates feel a little high for the quality of the rooms and the fact that you have to climb stairs (and we're from NYC), but you are right across from the Notre Dame, great if you get lost. Very close to the main drags of the Quartier Latin w/o being directly in the fray. Pack light, and try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Romantic, Great location - Paris flavor”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Rogier
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in room 36! We loved it! the flavor of the decor and the ambiance were perfect for Paris!...the location was wonderful as well...the stairs are a pain when carrying up the luggage, but otherwise, no complaints. the cute little cafe on the ground floor served fresh O.J. and bread/croissants every morning. it was my first time in Paris, I had such a wonderful experience, thanks to this place!!

HotelInfo.Name: Les Degres de Notre Dame
HotelInfo.Address: 10 rue des Grands-Degres, 75005 Paris, France
